intro: Marrubium praecox, commonly known as early horehound, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in open woodlands, grasslands, and along roadsides. Marrubium praecox is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat respiratory and digestive ailments.
